other_tests.findings: Asymmetrical septal hypertrophy, hyperdynamic left ventricle, late-peaking left ventricular outflow tract (LVOT) gradient of 129 mm Hg, increasing to 185 mm Hg with Valsalva maneuver, moderate to severe mitral regurgitation (MR).

LV apex pressure of 160/21 mm Hg, LVOT pressure of 141/21 mm Hg, and ascending aortic pressure of 126/65 mm Hg. Resting peak-to-peak gradients of 19 mm Hg within the LV cavity and 15 mm Hg at the level of the aortic valve.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The LVOT gradient increases to 105 mm Hg with the Valsalva maneuver.

other_tests.findings: Right atrial pressure is 8 mm Hg, right ventricular pressure is 35/10 mm Hg, and pulmonary capillary wedge pressure is 15 mm Hg.

other_tests.changes_over_time: Gradient variability is common; resting gradient is markedly less than that seen on echocardiography.

other_tests.findings: Pathology of the hypertrophied septum notable for myocyte disarray, interstitial fibrosis, and arterial hyperplasia consistent with hypertrophic cardiomyopathy (HCM).
other_tests.changes_over_time: Postoperatively, complete resolution of dyspnea on exertion noted.
